>Or you could instead use a JUnit 4 suite, using the Suite runner and the
>SuiteClasses annotation.

Now I've got sth like that:

@RunWith(Suite.class)
@SuiteClasses({package1.AllTests.class, package2.AllTests.class})
class MasterTest {}

And in packages 1 and 2:

@RunWith(Suite.class)
@SuiteClasses({...})
public class AllTests {}

All my tests are derived from an abstract class with @BeforeClass. And
@BeforeClass is still being run more than once for testing process :/ (I'm
asking Eclipse to run MasterTest()).
